intro: Cestrum album, commonly known as white cestrum, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Cestrum album is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant night-time fragrance.
